revised_title: An Investigation into the Teeth of Cartilaginous Fishes
tldr: The author examines the teeth of the Anarrhichas Lupus and Chaetodon Nigricans fish species, and provides evidence that cartilaginous fish have a perpetual renewal of their teeth. The study also highlights the unique structure and function of the teeth in these fish, as well as their role in the animal's diet and feeding habits.
